metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6812 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The first time AirPods are connected to an iPhone, they become named afterthe user's name by default (e.g. Jane Doe's AirPods.) Websites with cameraor microphone permission are able to enumerate device names, disclosing theuser's name. To resolve this issue, Firefox added a special case thatrenames devices containing the substring 'AirPods' to simply 'AirPods'.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.6, Firefox < 74, Firefox <ESR68.6, and Firefox ESR < 68.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
